snippet: Younger Americans die earlier and live in poorer health than their counterparts in 16 other developed countries, according to a new analysis of health and longevity in the United States.
abstract: Study of health and longevity by panel of experts convened by Institute of Medicine and National Research Council shows that young Americans have a lower life expectancy than young people in other developed countries.
lead_paragraph: Younger Americans die earlier and live in poorer health than their counterparts in 16 other developed countries, according to a new analysis of health and longevity in the United States.

headline.seo: Americans Under 50 Fare Poorly on Health Measures, New Report Says
headline.main: For Americans Under 50, Stark Findings on Health
headline.print_headline: For Americans Under 50, Stark Findings on Health
